tekst: Dan Turèll (1946-1993) was a Danish author known for his black clothing and distinctive appearance. He became an icon in Danish culture and literature.
He grew up in Vangede and later wrote the famous book 'Vangede Pictures', where he described his childhood and upbringing.
Dan Turèll wrote poetry, essays, and crime novels. His most famous crime series follows a journalist and became very popular in Denmark.
He was inspired by American Beat poetry and writers such as Jack Kerouac and Allen Ginsberg.
Dan Turèll died in 1993, but his works are still read today and he is considered one of Denmark’s most important modern authors.
